# Space Law Space Law is a collection of rules and regulations enforced by Security Officers on the station. Everyone is equal under the law, regardless of rank or title.
The violation of these Laws can be considered a failure of the duties of a security officer, and can be considered cause for demotion. These are not OOC rules and the violation of Space Law is not inherent grounds for admin intervention.

## Sentencing
The following are guidelines for the sentencing of crimes, based on severity:
[bold]Mischief[/bold]: 3 minutes of Brig confinement
[bold]Misdemeanor[/bold]: 5 minutes of Brig confinement
[bold]Felony[/bold]: 8 minutes of Brig Confinement
[bold]Grand Felony[/bold]: Permanent Brig confinement, Exile
[bold]Capital Crime[/bold]: Permanent Brig confinement, Exile, Execution
When sentencing crimes, only base the time off of the most serious crime committed. Do not combine sentences from multiple crimes.
For repeated instances of the same crime, the sentence can be elevated one level for each repeated offense. For example, the second occurence of a misdemeanor can be treated as a felony.
## Treatment of Prisoners
Prisoners are entitled to the following rights: - Prisoners must be given food and water as needed - Prisoners must be given access to medical care if required - Prisoners must be kept inside the brig or an equivalent facility ([color=gray][italic]if the brig is not currently operational[/italic][/color]) - Prisoners' belongings must be stored inside a secured prisoner closet - Prisoners must be safe and cannot be left in conditions that will result in their death
Failure to respect the rights of prisoners may lead to escalation or conflict from both the general public and authorities from other stations.
